abstract.text: Specifies the animation effects to apply when inserting or removing rows.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A reusable container view shown for a particular cell in a table view that uses rows for content.
Returns the row size style.
A set of related records, displayed in rows that represent individual records and columns that represent the attributes of those records.
Specifies the animation effects to apply when inserting or removing rows.
Use a fade for row or column removal. The effect can be combined with any of the slide constants.
Creates a gap for newly inserted rows. This is useful for drag and drop animations that animate to a newly opened gap and should be used in the delegate method
Animates a row insertion or removal by sliding downward.
Animates a row insertion by sliding from the left. Animates a row removal by sliding towards the left.
Animates a row insertion by sliding from the right. Animates a row removal by sliding towards the right.
Animates a row insertion or removal by sliding upward.
The following constants specify the autoresizing styles. These constants are used by the
property.
These constants specify the drag styles displayed by the table view. They’re used by
defines these constants to specify drop operations.
defines these constants to specify grid styles. These constants are used by the
property. The mask can be either
or it can contain either or both of the other options combined using the C bitwise
operator.
These constants define table row edges on which row actions are attached. They are used by the
delegate method.
The row size style constants define the size of the rows in the table view. They are used by the
and
properties. You can also query the row size in the
class’ property
The following constants specify the selection highlight styles. These constants are used by the
property.
The table view’s column autoresizing style.
The feedback style displayed when the user drags over the table view.
The effective row size style for the table.
The grid lines drawn by the table view.
The row size style (small, medium, large, or custom) used by the table view.
The selection highlight style used by the table view to indicate row and column selection.
Use no animation effects.
Called by
when the mouse button is released over a table view that previously decided to allow a drop.
Specifies that no grid lines should be displayed.
View-based table view instances use
to identify the nib file containing the template row view. You can specify a custom row view (without any code) by associating this key with the appropriate nib name in Interface Builder.

doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/App.title: Specifying a Custom Row View in a Nib File

abstract.text: Describes an unsigned integer.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type that can be converted to and from an associated raw value.
A type that provides mathematical set operations.
A type that can be initialized using an array literal.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
A type that presents a mathematical set interface to a bit set.
